resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

 Review comment:
   I don't; I saw this on one of Ben's PRs too. That time, I pulled and ran `make doc` and it was fixed. Maybe run it again yourself? If that doesn't work, try `R -e 'install.packages("roxygen2")'` and then `make doc` again; maybe it's a version issue.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

nealrichardson commented on pull request #6906: ARROW-8409: [R] Add R wrappers for getting and setting global CPU thread pool capacity
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6906#discussion_r407293703
 
 

 ##########
 File path: r/R/config.R
 ##########
 @@ -0,0 +1,31 @@
+# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
+# distributed with this work for additional information
+# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
+# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
+# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
+# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
+# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
+# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
+# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
+# specific language governing permissions and limitations
+# under the License.
+
+#' Return number of threads used by the global CPU thread pool in libarrow
+#'
+#' @export
+cpu_count <- function() {
+  GetCpuThreadPoolCapacity()
+}
+
+#' Set number of threads used by the global CPU thread pool in libarrow
+#'
+#' @param num_threads integer: New number of threads for thread pool
+#' @export
+set_cpu_count <- function(num_threads) {
+  SetCpuThreadPoolCapacity(num_threads)
 
 Review comment:
   ```suggestion
     SetCpuThreadPoolCapacity(as.integer(num_threads))
   ```
   
   so that you don't have to use the `L` suffix to indicate literal integers.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

 Review comment:
   If you want these functions to appear on the doc website table of contents, add `cpu_count` to the list in `r/_pkgdown.yml`, probably somewhere around L130. If you don't want to publicize these functions, add a line with `#' @keywords internal` around here (the man pages will still show up on the website, just not included on the ToC). Either way is fine with me.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: While some people will configure these with {{$OMP_NUM_THREADS}}, it is useful to be able to configure the global thread pool dynamically
fields.summary: [R] Add arrow::cpu_count, arrow::set_cpu_count wrapper functions a la Python
